sys_one_extend_definition_attribute.default_value: The Montana WIC (Women, Infants, and Children) program is a federally funded nutrition program that assists pregnant women, new mothers, infants, and children under the age of 5. Here's a brief overview: Eligibility: To qualify, you must be pregnant, breastfeeding, or have a child under 5, be a resident of Montana, meet income guidelines, and have a nutritional need. Benefits: WIC provides: Healthy Foods: Vouchers to purchase nutritious foods like fruits, vegetables, milk, cereal, and juice. Nutrition Education: Counseling and classes to help families make healthy food choices. Breastfeeding Support: Information and resources to support breastfeeding mothers. Referrals: Connections to other health and social services. If you think you might qualify for WIC, you can contact your local health department to apply.
sys_one_extend_definition_attribute.description: Describes the program that the records will be created in support of.
sys_one_extend_definition_attribute.label: Program description
sys_one_extend_definition_attribute.name: program_description
